designation: Associate Professor, School of Computer Science and Engineering
biography: Before moving to NTU Singapore, I was a research fellow at the Australian Centre for Robotic Vision (ACRV),  affiliated with The University of Adelaide. I completed my PhD degree at the University of Adelaide in 2014. I received my bachelor's and master's degree from the South China University of Technology (SCUT) in 2007 and 2010, respectively.
interests: My research interests are in computer vision applications including scene understanding and generative learning.
grants: Delta - NTU Corporate Laboratory (Phase 2) (Delta)Delta WP5: Multi-Level Situation Awareness for Safe and Efficient Multi-agent Collaboration in Smart ManufacturingDeveloping ‘Software as a Medical Device’ (SaMD) from 3D vitreous-retinalchoroidal imaging modalities, to enhance the clinical management of uveitisLearning Deep Networks on 3D and 4D Point Clouds for Holistic 3D Scene UnderstandingLearning Local Correspondences for Conditional Dense PredictionsLearning with Less DataMessage Propagation Methods for 3D Visual UnderstandingNTU-Delta Corporate Laboratory (Phase 2) (IAF-ICP)Ricci curvature based deep learning model for polymer informaticsSemantic 3D Understanding for indoor VR/AR ApplicationsTowards Realistic Deep Learning for 3D VisionWP5: Multi-level situation awareness for safe and efficient multi-agent collaboration in smart manufacturing (IAF-ICP)
